title: Establishing the COVID-19 Pandemic Testing Board and Ensuring a Sustainable Public Health Workforce for COVID-19 and Other Biological Threats

enrichment.summary: This executive order creates a COVID-19 Pandemic Testing Board to coordinate and expand COVID-19 testing efforts across the federal government, supports making testing widely available and free for uninsured individuals, and establishes a program to build a sustainable public health workforce to respond to COVID-19 and future biological threats. It also directs agencies to improve testing access in priority populations and high-risk settings and to develop plans for long-term public health workforce capacity.
potential_concerns: Coordination challenges between multiple federal agencies and jurisdictions may delay or complicate testing and workforce efforts.
Ensuring equitable access to testing and public health resources for vulnerable and hard-to-reach populations could be difficult in practice.
Sustaining funding and political support for the public health workforce program in the long term may be uncertain.
Privacy and data security concerns could arise from expanded testing, contact tracing, and data sharing activities.
Relying on a newly established workforce like the U.S. Public Health Job Corps may face recruitment, training, and deployment challenges.
